intro: Cornutia cayennensis, commonly known as the Cayenne cornutia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinctive, elongated calyx. Cornutia cayennensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
